text: Yahrzeit (Yiddish, from German, yahr, year, plus zeit, time)Sephardic Jews usually use the Hebrew word nakhala, inheritance. in Judaism is the yearly observance of the death of a close family member. There are a number of common customs for Jews observing a yahrzeit. These include remembering the relative, lighting memorial candles, saying special prayers, giving money to charity, and visiting the grave of the relative. The date of the yahrzeit is fixed by the Hebrew calendar. == References == ==Other websites== * Category:Judaism Category:Death customs
